description._content: "Personnel of Pageant Principals Miss Deseronto, MISS URSULA BRENNAN Miss Canada, MISS NORA STODDART Father Time, HERBERT AYLSWORTH Capt. John Deserontyou, CHIEF FRANCIS JOHN Spirit of the Wilderness, MISS MADGE CULHANE Pioneer Man, BERT BOWEN Pioneer Woman, MISS PEARL McCULLOUGH Fever, MRS. T. L. McCULLOUGH Famine, MISS BEATRICE STEWART Death, CAP. V. G. PEARCE Major Vanalstine, M. OSTRANDER School Marm, MRS. T. L. McCULLOUGH Paul Huff, L. E. TUNNICLIFFE Minister, KENNETH BOWEN ** IN ADDITION TO THE ABOVE PRINICPALS there are some two hundred and fifty-six people taking part as follows: Attendants to Miss Deseronto The Provinces Creation Girls Flower Girls Sky Girls Land Girls Mohawks Dancing Girls United Empire Loyalists School Children Sir Roger de Coverly Members of First Church Concluding with the 'MASQUE OF THE NATIONS' with Maple Leaf Girls English Girls Irish Girls Scotch Girls Dutch Girls French Girls Belgian Girls Italian Girls Jack Tars Boy Scouts" Page 19 of the souvenir and programme for the 1929 Loyalist celebrations in Deseronto, Ontario. Page 18 Page 20 A photograph of the pageant participants can be seen at 2011.09.
